title-group.article-title: Charted Territory: Canadian Literature by Women, the Genealogical Plot, and SKY Lee's Disappearing Moon Cafe

Kam- boureli 175

As Plaut remarks, "While the natural order of birth was believed [in early biblical days] to have divine approval, God was not bound by it in an automatic relationship [. ..]. Many of Israel's great men came to their prominence because God took them out of their inferior natural position: Joseph, Ephraim, Moses, and David all were second- or late-born" (175).
